data.title: Added VS 2013 templates. Uses correct version of the Microsoft.VisualStudio.SmartDevice.ProjectSystem.Base assembly
data.body:
Currently VS 2013 templates are built from \ProjectTemplates\VisualStudio2012\ folder. 
But I found that \WindowsPhone__Game.vstemplate file has a reference to the old version of the _Microsoft.VisualStudio.SmartDevice.ProjectSystem.Base_ assembly:

```
<Assembly>Microsoft.VisualStudio.SmartDevice.ProjectSystem.Base, Version=11.0.0.0, Culture=Neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a</Assembly>
```

Due to this it was impossible to create Windows Phone project in VS 2013.
I've changed this version to v12.0.0.0 and updated build files. 
Now it works correctly.

Best regards,
Ilia

data.title: added support for comparison samplers (DirectX only)
data.body:
Comparison samplers allows to use SampleCmp methods in HLSL. For example, this feature can be really useful when implementing shadow mapping.

Also moved ToComparisson method to SharpDXHelper, so it might be reused in several places.

data.title: Make SpriteBatch.DrawString() an atomic operation.
data.body:
SpriteBatch.DrawString() is _really_ slow when SpriteSortMode is "Immediate", as it flushes after every character. If we treat DrawString as a single Draw call, and flush after all characters are drawn, we can reduce the number of GL calls drastically and get a significant performance improvement.

This reduces number of draw calls by ~90% in some text-heavy scenes, without (as far as I can tell) diverging from the Xna spec. Doesn't seem to break anything in the MonoGame tests, either!

-- David

data.title: some soundeffect issues about wp8
data.body: when i load soundeffect,it will not  work at all i use content.load<soundeffect> to load sound , but it returns null and throw some expections

data.title: Correctly set the ProductID to a new GUID
data.body: The ProductID in WMAppManifest.xml was explicitly set, resulting in deployment overwriting previously deployed apps. This ProductID should match that in AssemblyInfo.cs.

data.title: Win8 suspend
data.body: Fixes issue with latest Win 8 Store Cert tests failing because app does not respond to suspend requests

data.title: TouchPanel state becomes corrupted and stops correctly processing pinch gestures
Added SoundEffect and Song support to WinRT
data.body:
Apparently, it was already possible to play mp3 Song on WinRT, but the code in the ContentManager was excluded by a #if !WINRT .

I also added .wma as a supported extension for Song on WinRT.

I then added the SoundEffect(string filename) constructor based on the example given here : http://sharpdx.org/forum/7-documentation/39-audio-samples

Finaly, I resolved a NullReferenceException in the static constructor of the MediaPlayer with the help of this : http://stackoverflow.com/a/17315187

data.title: Monogame 3.2 + WP8 - Black screen
data.body:
I have reinstalled Windows, than installed VS2012, WPSDK8, VS2013. 
I've downloaded Monogame 3.2 (Oct 12).

And I've created a new Monogame-WP8 project.
When I run the game, I see only black screen and the SystemTray info.

After some debugging I've seen that LoadContent, Update and Draw methods are not invoked.
This issue exists for 20 days already.

data.title: GamePad.SetVibration is not Implemented
Color as a StructLayout
data.body:
This is a proposition to turn color into a StructLayout (equivalent to unions in C).
It would be nice to have since it makes manipulating Colors a bit faster.

Can people please check this on other platforms to identify any endian issues?
So far it's tested on:
x86 (AMD Phenom II / Windows 8 / store app)
Snapdragon ARM (S4 APQ8060A / Windows RT / store app)

data.title: Added support for getting the latest built iOS assemblies from a mac build job
data.body:
Now that Xamarin supports iOS projects in VS it makes sense to deploy the iOS assemblies in the installer (if that product is installed). 

We need a iOS game template for VS. 
And we need to apply the same logic for android.

data.title: EnabledGestures Changes Cause Infinite-Loop in IsGestureAvailable
data.body:
In porting my open-source Invasion game from XNA/WP7 to MonoGame/WP8, I noticed that the TouchPanel state occasionally becomes messed up and causes the game to (A) stop responding to gestures and (B) lock-up the UI.

The source code for Invasion is linked from my CodeProject article here: http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/620177/Invasion-Game-in-MonoGame-for-Windows-Phone-8

In the debugger, I found that I could repeat this problem 100% of the time whenever EnabledGestures changed and the IsEnabledGesture is subsequently called.  The easiest way to repeat this is to (A) remove the patch that I put in the code to mask this problem, and (B) keep tapping on the screen once you have cleared all UFOs from it and are waiting for the next level to begin.

In the debugger I have seen that IsGestureAvailable's "while (_gestureEvents.Count > 0)" loop goes infinite because abandoned _gestureEvents get stuck in it.

Somewhere in TouchPanel these stale _gestureEvents must be removed from the list to prevent an infinite-loop from occurring.

data.title: Can't MediaPlayer.Stop User's Music to Play Game Music
data.body:
On WP8 there is a requirement that if the user is currently playing Music when a game is started, the game must ask the user if it's OK to stop their music in order for the game to play its own music (for example, a background music track played by the MediaPlayer).  

Unfortunately, the same code used in XNA on WP7/WP8 to stop the user's music isn't working in MonoGame - it has no effect.  The MediaPlayer.State == Stopped when the game starts up, even if the user is currently playing music, so calling MediaPlayer.Stop() does nothing - and the user's music continues playing.

data.title: Using current codebase, not getting touches when using DrawingSurface
data.body:
If I run my project using the old DrawingSurfaceBackgroundGrid touches are reported fine without issue but obviously this cannot do Landscape.

However when using the new method with DrawingSurface I not getting touch events, tested with or without gestures enabled

Occasionally one will get through but it usually becomes locked and is never released.

Ideas?

data.title: Vector4 fix #2
data.body: Here I take into account the warnings from Tom. This version contains only ToString rewrited to conservative form and fix for GetHashCode. Correct me if Im wrong in some way and I rewrite selected code.

data.title: Implementation of Matrix.CreateShadow(...)
data.body: Implementation of Matrix.CreateShadow(...)

data.title: fix for VertexBuffer.GetData<>()
Rename SwapChainBackgroundPanel
data.body:
References to SwapChainBackgroundPanel are currently named
'SwapChainPanel' (and sometimes 'swapPanel').

DX11.2/Win8.1 introduces a new UIElement,  'SwapChainPanel'.
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/bg182880.aspx#three

I renamed all SwapChainBackgroundPanel because having then referred as
swapChainPanel could be confusing in the near future.

Arguments become -> 'swapChainBackgroundPanel'
Properties become -> 'SwapChainBackgroundPanel {get;set;}'
fields become -> '_swapChainBackgroundPanel'

data.body: Also , added the FontTextureProcessor

data.body:
- Added forwards to methods where identical code was copy-pasted
- Removed unnecessary f's

data.title: Uninstaller fix.
data.body: Last time I realized VS2013 templates. But I forgot add this line for properly uninstall them.

data.title: Components.Add(...) should not Initialize Components
data.body:
Components are auto initializes only during Game.Initialize(..).
After that one should explicitly initialize its componts before use.

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/1803

data.title: Remove _initialized check from DrawableGameComponent.GraphicsDevice
data.body:
Initially i put the check there as was implemented by @Aztherion.

I did some testings and found that XNA doesn't enforce any similar test.
After all GraphicsDevice is already initialized by Game. It's logical
that someone might want to do some non-content initialization on the
constractor of DrawableGameComponent based on values from
GraphicsDevice.

data.title: Texture2D.FromStream fails with GIF on some Androids
data.body: I have a GIF image - which I know Android doesn't want to support.  On my Samsung Galaxy 4, it loads and displays fine with Texture2D.FromStream loading it in from a raw, downloaded file.  On the Nexus 7 tablet, it fails - displaying a black square.  I've read that Android has an open bug where GIFs of a different density than the screen display this way, but aren't prioritizing a fix.  Is there any way MonoGame could auto-scale the density for GIFs on this platform?

data.title: Monogame SIGSEGV on Game.Exit();
data.body: I'm sorry, I posted this in the wrong fork. Please erase it.

data.title: Linux support for MonoDevelop plugin
data.body:
Hi there,

This pull request add Linux support for the MonoDevelop plugin with the latest revision of MonoDevelop. I don't have made big changes so all must be good.

This plugin work with the latest MonoDevelop version from git. It work well on Linux, you just have to compile it yourself if your package manager haven't it.

I also update ThirdParty repo because there are some deps needed by Linux (libfreetype, etc.)

data.title: Fix android song end detection
data.body:
_androidPlayer is static but wasn't being correctly treated like it was, so the listener wouldn't work correctly.

Also fix Duration and Position properties (milliseconds not seconds)
And remove all the _androidPlayer != null calls as it can never be null.

There are a few whitespace changes, so add ?w=1 to compare

Note that Android still has its own Song.cs file, I could merge this in to the shared one and send a PR for that instead if you want, that's probably the right thing to do.
